Name: Sangaree (Sangria)
Ingredients: 5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: STIR first 6 ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass. TOP with soda.
Review: Summer in a glass. Heavy wine tannins are sweetened, lightened and infused with fruit.
History: This version of Spanish Sangria was popular in 19th-century America. The only real difference is that while Sangria is usually made in batches, Sangria is single-serve.
Nutrition: One serving of Sangaree (Sangria) contains 190 calories
Garnish: Slices of strawberry, orange and lemon with mint sprig bouquet
